getting_started.welcome_title: 🏠 Welcome to the Invoice Management System
getting_started.system_desc: This is an **automated invoice processing system** designed specifically for leather industry businesses. It helps you convert Excel files into professional invoices and manage your invoice database.
getting_started.what_can_do: ### What can it do for you?
features: 📄 **Convert Excel files** into professional invoices automatically
💾 **Store all invoices** in an organized database
who_list: **Anyone** who needs to convert Excel data to invoices
benefits_list: **Stay organized** - All data in one place
getting_started.step1_desc:
- Use your existing Excel format
- Make sure it has columns like:
  - PO Number
  - Item Code
  - Quantity
  - Price
  - Amount
getting_started.step2_desc:
- Go to the appropriate page:
  - "High Quality Leather" for premium products
  - "2nd Layer Leather" for secondary products
- Upload your Excel file
- Click "Process"
getting_started.step3_desc:
- Check the "Verify" page
- Review the processed data
- Click "Accept" to add to database
- Your invoices are ready!

adding_invoices.title: ➕ Adding New Invoices
adding_invoices.desc: There are **two ways** to add invoices to the system:
high_quality_list: Click "**High Quality Leather**" in the sidebar
second_layer_list: Click "**2nd Layer Leather**" in the sidebar

adding_invoices.verification_desc: After processing, you'll need to **verify your data**:
verification_steps: You'll see a preview of your data
Check that all information is correct:
If everything looks good, click "**✅ Accept**"

adding_invoices.tip_message: 💡 **Tip**: Always double-check your data before accepting. Once accepted, the data goes into your permanent database.

header_mapping.title: 🔧 Excel Header Mapping Guide
header_mapping.desc: ⚠️ **CRITICAL**: Without proper header mapping, NO DATA will flow through to create invoices! Use this guide to ensure your Excel headers match exactly what the system expects.
header_mapping.mapping_desc: The system needs to identify which columns in your Excel file contain specific data (like PO numbers, quantities, etc.). Sometimes your column names might be different from what the system expects.
header_mapping.required_headers_desc: Your Excel file must contain these data types. Here are the **actual mappings from the system** - use the EASIEST option first:
header_mappings: **PO Number** → EASIEST: 'po' | Also accepts: 'PO', 'PO NO.', '订单号'
**Item Code** → EASIEST: 'item' | Also accepts: '物料代码', 'ITEM NO.', 'Item No'
**Square Feet** → EASIEST: 'sqft' | Also accepts: 'SF', '尺数', '出货数量(sf)'
**Net Weight** → EASIEST: 'net' | Also accepts: 'NW', '净重', 'net weight'
**Description** → EASIEST: 'description' | Also accepts: '产品名称', '品名规格', 'desc'
**Production Order** → EASIEST: 'production_order_no' | Also accepts: 'TTX编号', '生产单号'
mapping_issues: **Different Language**: Headers in local language (Khmer, Chinese, etc.)
**Special Characters**: Headers with symbols or punctuation
solution1_steps: Rename column headers to the EASIEST options above
Examples: '订单号' → 'po', '物料代码' → 'item', '总张数' → 'pcs'
Use simple lowercase English words when possible
Save the file and try processing again
solution2_steps: Take a screenshot of your Excel headers
Note which columns contain which data
- Screenshot of your Excel file headers
- Description of what data each column contains
- Request to add your header names to the system mapping
header_mapping.example_desc: Here's an example of how to map common variations:
example_table: '物料代码' → 'item' → Item Code (CRITICAL for invoices)
'出货数量(sf)' → 'sqft' → Square Feet (CRITICAL for invoices)
header_best_practices: **Use English names** when possible for better compatibility
**Be consistent** - use the same header names across all files
**First row only** - put headers in the first row of your Excel file
admin_help: If you frequently use Excel files with non-standard headers:
Contact your administrator to add your header variations to the system
Provide examples of your typical Excel file formats
The admin can configure the system to recognize your specific header names

troubleshooting.title: ❓ Troubleshooting & FAQ
troubleshooting.issue0_desc: **90% of problems are caused by incorrect column headers!**
troubleshooting.issue0_solution: **SOLUTION: Go to Header Mapping tab and use these exact headers:**
issue1_cause_list: Excel file format is not supported (use .xlsx)
❗ **MOST COMMON**: Wrong column headers - system can't find your data!
Missing required columns (PO, Item, Amount, etc.)
Data in wrong format (text in number columns)
issue1_solution_list: 🔧 **CHECK HEADER MAPPING TAB FIRST** - Fix your column headers!
Make sure numbers are formatted as numbers, not text
issue2_cause_list: Complex formulas in the Excel file
issue2_solution_list: Remove empty rows from your Excel file
Copy data to a new, clean Excel file
issue3_cause_list: Is the invoice actually in the database? (Check "Database")
Are you searching with the correct reference number?
issue4_cause_list: In a different status (check voided invoices)
troubleshooting.issue5_desc: **Excel file uploads but no invoices are created:**
issue5_cause_list: ❗ **#1 REASON**: Column headers don't match system expectations
System can't find PO, Item, Amount, or other critical columns
Headers in wrong language or format
issue5_solution_list: 🔧 **GO TO HEADER MAPPING TAB** - This fixes 90% of issues!
Check your Excel headers match the examples exactly
If still failing, try the alternative headers listed in Header Mapping tab
before_help_list: 🔧 **CHECK HEADER MAPPING TAB FIRST** - Solves most problems!
Verify your Excel headers match the system requirements
Check if your Excel file works with other data
Note any error messages you see
when_contacting_list: Describe what you were trying to do
Mention which file you were processing
